verses.roman:
pralobhito varair yat tvam
apramādāya viddhi tat
na dhīr ekānta-bhaktānām
āśīrbhir bhidyate kvacit

synonyms: pralobhitaḥ—enticed; varaiḥ—with benedictions; yat—which fact; tvam—you; apramādāya—for (showing your) freedom from bewilderment; viddhi—please know; tat—that; na—not; dhīḥ—the intelligence; ekānta—exclusive; bhaktānām—of devotees; āśīrbhiḥ—by blessings; bhidyate—is diverted; kvacit—ever.
translation: Understand that I enticed you with benedictions just to prove that you would not be deceived. The intelligence of My unalloyed devotees is never diverted by material blessings.
